name: FetchIncidentLogs
description:
Retrieve all incident log entries from the account.

This tool retrieves a comprehensive list of all log entries for incidents across the entire account. Use it to access detailed logs of events related to incidents.

parameters.name: accept_header
parameters.description: The versioning header for API requests. Specify the API version to use.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: response_content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the media type for the response. Must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of log entry results to return per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset value to start the pagination of search results. Used for controlling which set of results are displayed.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: render_results_in_time_zone
parameters.description: Specify the time zone for rendering results. Defaults to the account's time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: start_date_range
parameters.description: The start date for the range to search incident log entries. Format as 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: end_date_range
parameters.description: Specify the end date for the search date range. This is used to filter log entries up to a specific date.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: additional_models_to_include
parameters.description: Array of additional models such as 'incidents', 'services', 'channels', 'teams' to include in the response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: team_ids
parameters.description: An array of team IDs for filtering log entries by team. Requires 'teams' ability.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses, showing the total number of items.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: overview_only
parameters.description: Set to true to return only the most important changes to incidents.

value_schema.description: If `true`, will return a subset of log entries that show only the most important changes to the incident.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: is_overview
parameters.description: If `true`, will return a subset of log entries that show only the most important changes to the incident.

value_schema.description: If `true`, will return a subset of log entries that show only the most important changes to the incident.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: team_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
